definition: (martial arts) wind-and-fire wheel, weapon used in hand-to-hand fighting/(Daoism) a magical pair of wheels on which one can stand to ride at great speed, used by Nezha 哪吒[Ne2 zha5]/(fig.) never-ending treadmill
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn

sentences.english: Bicycle sense of shock color gas nozzle lights, Hot Wheels, lights.
sentences.chinese: 自行车感震变色气嘴灯，风火轮，车灯。

sentences.english: Do you want to design your own cool Hot Wheels car?
sentences.chinese: 你想自己设计一款很酷的风火轮赛车吗？

definition: golden cudgel, weapon wielded by Sun Wukong in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]
proceeding at a tremendous pace/getting on like a house on fire
The Nine-Toothed Rake (weapon of Zhu Bajie 豬八戒|猪八戒[Zhu1 Ba1 jie4])
lit. to have three heads and six arms (idiom)/fig. to possess remarkable abilities/a being of formidable powers
as lithe as a swallow (of athlete or beautiful girl)
